title: Sparks of Artificial General Intelligence: Early experiments with GPT-4

last_post.content: [2303.12712] Sparks of Artificial General Intelligence: Early experiments with GPT-4 https://arxiv.org/abs/2303.12712

I'm less sanguine about LLMs than I was in December when I said they're essentially "asking a supercomputer to get really good at mansplaining."

I really encourage folks to check out this paper on some of GPT4's capabilities.
https://arxiv.org/pdf/2303.12712.pdf

Some of this is undoubtedly overstated. And none of this disputes the very real concerns about bias, misuse, and disinformation.

But look at some of these examples (pics attached). It's hard to reconcile with "word prediction on steroids."

title: The Unraveling of the U.S. News College Rankings

last_post.content:
Each year, #USNews & World Reports rank colleges and universities, as follows: they try a bunch of different ranking algorithms, see which generates the results they like, and then choose which to deploy.

I mean we all knew that their rankings were absolute crap, but the fact that anyone would out and admit this in public—while not under oath–is truly remarkable.

https://www.wsj.com/articles/u-s-news-college-rankings-yale-law-fe24f0b2

ht @briannosek

title: GitHub - thi-ng/tpl-umbrella-fxhash: Project template repo for generative art projects on the fx(hash) platform

last_post.content:
Last night I updated all the #ThingUmbrella template repos too, incl. the #Ziglang #WASM one, now configured to use the latest dev version of Zig (0.11.0-dev-2266 or newer) by default. Also big shout out to Marcus Wågberg for updating the build script to support most recent Zig nightlies. More comments & install instructions in the readme. Still hoping to do a short video about getting started with this setup (and to explain more how the various template parts relate to each other):

https://github.com/thi-ng/tpl-umbrella-zig

Other project templates:

For (fx)hash #GenerativeArt projects (with dummy content):
https://github.com/thi-ng/tpl-umbrella-fxhash

Barebones:
https://github.com/thi-ng/tpl-umbrella-basic

#TypeScript 5.0 has a new compiler flag "verbatimModuleSyntax" which supersedes the now deprecated "importsNotUsedAsValues" and changes how type-only imports are being treated[1]. TypeScript catches most (not all!) of these occurrences as bugs, and after reviewing imports all 4000(!)+ resulting JavaScript files over the weekend (and finding & fixing another dozen or so cases), I just pushed new releases of all 179 #ThingUmbrella packages[2], now compatible with TS5.0! 🎉

One other (somewhat related) still outstanding issue to address soon is the new TC39-compatible decorator handling/behavior... I already tried updating these semi-successfully, but then deferred the work again when I realized that I'll first have to do a lot more reading & experimenting with this new setup (esp. related to mixins). The changes are quite major... Anyhow, steady progress, small steps, more often...

Happy Coding! :)

[1] https://devblogs.microsoft.com/typescript/announcing-typescript-5-0/#breaking-changes-and-deprecations

[2] https://thi.ng/umbrella

title: Six Centuries of Type & Printing (letterpress and ebook bundle)

last_post.content: Back in 2020, I published Six Centuries of Type & Printing, a concise book – 64 pages – that actually starts centuries before Gutenberg, with Chinese and Korea printing, and then digs into 1450 to 2020, covering ~600 years of technological advances. Set in hot-metal type (Monotype Bembo) in North Yorkshire, printed in London, and bound in Germany with a foil-stamped cover & slipcase, I still have copies available for shipping worldwide! https://glog.glennf.com/tiny-type-museum-time-capsule-and-more/six-centuries-letterpress (ebook edition available)

title: Government funds mandatory air purifiers at schools - The Korea Herald

last_post.content:
South Korean Governmen funds mandatory air purifiers at schools

The government passed a revised school health act to improve quality of air and safety at preschools and primary and secondary schools.

The law requires installation of air-cleaning and air quality sensors in classrooms and allows state funds to cover costs. School councils and parents are also permitted to attend classroom air quality monitoring sessions, which will be conducted each semester.

@whn #covid
https://www.koreaherald.com/view.php?ud=20190327000802

title: Liberal MP Moira Deeming suspended for nine months but avoids expulsion over controversial rally

last_post.content:
I’m kind of fascinated by the politics of the Australian TERF movement. Moira Deeming, Katherine Deves, etc understand that it’s political suicide to be associated with Nazis (and the Liberal party really doesn’t want to be linked to them) but they’re wedged by the fact that a lot of US/UK TERFs like Posie Parker have gone all in and embraced the far right.

That said, mostly I just feel tired. I hate that my life is a culture war politics issue 😔

https://www.abc.net.au/news/2023-03-27/moira-deeming-liberal-vote-on-expulsion-from-parliamentary-party/102148216

OKAY #newstodon WE GOT A SHOT AT THIS

16 hours ago the #TexasObserver - a 69 (nice) year old paper and #mastodon trailblazer - was going to shut down Friday.

16 hours later the emergency fundraiser to save the paper is _over_ halfway to goal _already_.

If you care about non-corporate-owned #news now is a damned good time to step up.

If you care about Mastodon mattering, how's the headline "Mastodon Saves Historic Newspaper" sound to you?

LET'S GO NEWSBIANS LET'S GO

title: GitHub - thi-ng/tpl-umbrella-zig: Minimal thi.ng/umbrella browser project template for hybrid TypeScript & Zig apps, using thi.ng/wasm-api for bridging both worlds and Vite as dev tool/server & bundler...

last_post.content:
Last night I updated all the #ThingUmbrella template repos too, incl. the #Ziglang #WASM one, now configured to use the latest dev version of Zig (0.11.0-dev-2266 or newer) by default. Also big shout out to Marcus Wågberg for updating the build script to support most recent Zig nightlies. More comments & install instructions in the readme. Still hoping to do a short video about getting started with this setup (and to explain more how the various template parts relate to each other):

https://github.com/thi-ng/tpl-umbrella-zig

Other project templates:

For (fx)hash #GenerativeArt projects (with dummy content):
https://github.com/thi-ng/tpl-umbrella-fxhash

Barebones:
https://github.com/thi-ng/tpl-umbrella-basic

🆕 Pandoc 3.1.2 is out! It comes with:
- a #Typst writer,
- support for Typst as a PDF engine,
- a Lua REPL, also adding ways to debug Lua filters interactively, and
- native builds for Apple silicon.
